page.title: 03Farming in Arundel
page.content: The well-drained land of the chalk downs to the north supports{arable farming and the low-lying, heavy clay soils of the water meadows in the south is mainly used for{dairy {farming. There are about 10 farms in the area, many being amalgamations of smaller farms. Few are privately owned, most are part of the{Norfolk Estate}and farmed by tenants. Typical size is 300-400 acres. Most farms are mixed, reflecting a mixture of chalk and clay soils, but with{E.E.C.}incentives, there is a definite trend away from darying towards arable wherever possible. Dairy herds are mainly Friesian. There is beef and sheep grazing. Main arable crops are wheat, barley, maize, oats, potatoes and rape. There is some horticulture in the area.
